Student organizations

Student organizations

symBIOsis

symBIOsis was founded in 2020 by members of of MInDS, a graduate student organization in the Department of Biology.

Among other things, we organize practice rotation talks for first years, mock qualifying exams for second years, advising meetings on topics like choosing thesis labs and writing grant applications, and social events like virtual trivia nights and movie screenings.

We also run (and often serve as mentors for) the BioBuddies program, which pairs incoming CMDB first years with upper-year mentors.

Teaching

Iâ€™m currently a teaching assistant for Developmental Genetics Lab AS.020.340 for undergraduates.

Earlier this year, I worked with a fellow grad student in my lab, Dylan Taylor, to develop a two-part computational biology workshop series on hidden markov models for Agara Bio, a community bio lab led by JHU students.
